title: Coleen Rooney has ‘destroyed’ her private life says WAG
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Coleen Rooney accusing Rebekah Vardy of selling false stories about her has well and truly divided the WAGs.

The 33-year-old, who is married to DC United footballer Wayne Rooney, posted a shocking message on social media claiming to have discovered that fellow WAG Rebekah had leaked stories from Coleen’s private Instagram account to the press.

Rebekah, 37, furiously denied the allegations and suggested she may have been hacked.

But WAGs Chantelle Hesky and Kerry Whelpdale are conflicted over whether Coleen was in the wrong.

Criticising Coleen for making the issue public, Kerry said on Good Morning Britain: ‘It’s a real shame Coleen couldn’t just pick up the phone and speak to her.

‘No one should sell a story on anyone, I think that is unacceptable and I’m not saying that. I’m saying it shouldn’t have been dealt with this way.

‘Coleen could have gone down the route where she got a private investigator… I think she’s going to be in the public eye so much more, they’re both going to get trolling.’

Rebekah denies Coleen’s leak claims (Picture: Getty/Rex)

Chanetelle has been married to Emile since 2014 (Picture: Getty Images)

She added: ‘Rebekah’s had horrendous things sent to her.

‘It’s a form of bullying in a way and I think it’s unacceptable. I do not agree with anyone selling stories on anyone but I just think there’s a better way to deal with it.’

Hours after the drama unfolded, Rebekah, who is currently pregnant, shared a horrible message from an Instagram troll wishing harm on her unborn child.

Kerry, who is married to footballer Chris Whelpdale, continued: ‘She’s gone to up here from her bringing that out so her private life is completely destroyed from this and is going to bring up all stuff from the past as well.’

However, Chantelle felt Coleen was right to address the situation publicly and drew on her own experience from close friends selling stories about her.

Advertisement

Chantelle recalls how someone in her inner circle leaked stories about her relationship with husband Emile Heskey when they were in the early stages of dating.

‘It’s a small circle of friends you’ve got as it is, and it’s someone you thought you’d trust, it must be hard,’ Chantelle weighed in.

‘Maybe because Coleen’s so quiet and private usually, maybe enough is enough.

‘I think she’s done her [Rebekah] a favour so now she can see where she’s compromised.

Rebekah suggests her account was hacked (Picture: ITV/REX)

‘WAGs are supposed to stick together.’

But Kerry said Coleen should have considered her young children and what they may come across on social media.

‘I just think I don’t want my children growing up – they’re not on social media yet – but I don’t want them thinking that’s the right way to go about handling situations.

‘I would rather them talk to somebody [privately]. I just think they could have done it a lot better,’ she said.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays at 6am on ITV.
